content:
DECISION 5-1: CLI Client Implementation Design

AUTHOR: agent-cli

ARCHITECTURE:

1. Binary crate at cli/ with separate command modules
2. Uses clap derive macros for clean argument parsing
3. reqwest with tokio for async HTTP operations

COMMAND STRUCTURE:
- notebook write <notebook_id> - Create new entry
- notebook revise <notebook_id> <entry_id> - Revise existing entry
- notebook read <notebook_id> <entry_id> - Get entry with metadata
- notebook browse <notebook_id> - Get catalog
- notebook share <notebook_id> - Grant/revoke access
- notebook observe <notebook_id> - Watch for changes
- notebook list - List accessible notebooks
- notebook create <name> - Create new notebook
- notebook delete <notebook_id> - Delete notebook

CONFIGURATION:
- NOTEBOOK_URL env var (default: http://localhost:3000)
- Optional NOTEBOOK_AUTHOR_ID for authenticated operations

OUTPUT MODES:
- JSON (default) - Machine readable for programmatic use
- --human flag - Pretty formatted for interactive use
- Error messages to stderr with appropriate exit codes

DEPENDENCIES:
- clap 4.x with derive feature
- reqwest with json feature
- tokio with rt-multi-thread, macros
- serde/serde_json for serialization
- thiserror for error handling
- colored for human-readable output

REFERENCES: Task assignment 5-1
author: anonymous
